questions.question_text: What are ways to measure trustworthy data? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDEF
Dependanbility - data consitent and accurate? 
Reliability - data validated? 
Credibility – data believable? 
Transferability – data useful?

Selected Answer: CDEF
A common management observation which applies here is that “you cannot manage what you do not measure”. When measuring how trustworthy your data is, consider:
 • Dependability – is the data consistent and accurate?
 • Reliability – is the data validated?
 • Credibility – how believable is the data?
 • Transferability -- how useful is the data?

Selected Answer: CDEF
As mentioned in the HAM Fundamentals (Trustworthy Data):
1. Dependability
2. Reliability
3. Credibility 
4. Transferability

Selected Answer: CDEF
Page 60 of Vancouver book

Selected Answer: CDEF
CDEF
Reliability, transferability, credibility and dependability

Selected Answer: CDEF
Credibility is the 4th, not sustainability

questions.question_text: What information would you find on me Model Management tab of me Hardware Asset dashboard? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Hardware models up for end of life
choices.F: New hardware assets found by audits
choices.E: Hardware model purchase orders pending delivery

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Checked my instance

choices.A: The service must be opted in to and can be opted out of in the future, if required.
choices.C: A script must be defined to identify what information should be shared with the Content Service.
choices.E: The service is automatically enabled through the baseline installation but can be opted out of, if required.
choices.D: Nothing. The service is atomically enabled and cannot be opted out of.
choices.B: The service must be opted in to, but once enabled it cannot be opted out of.
